title: The Wall Street Journal: Under Armour says data of 150 million MyFitnessPal users was exposed
text:
Under Armour Inc. said someone improperly accessed data from one of its fitness-tracking apps in late February, affecting some 150 million users on its MyFitnessPal platform.
User data such as emails, usernames and passwords were exposed, but government-issued identifiers like Social Security and driver’s license numbers, as well as credit-card information, weren’t compromised, the athletic-wear company said. Under Armour said it has enlisted data-security firms and law enforcement to investigate the scope of the breach.
